cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTTO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.laOST SECRET.COPY NO.follow.M. (40) 182nd CONCLUSIONS, MINUTE 2.Confidential Annex.(25th June, 1940 - 6 p.m.)PRANCE.The french fleet.(previous reference:W.M.(40) 181stConclusions,Minute 13. )The ifer Cabinet were informed that the RICHELIEUhad sailed from Dakar at 2.15 p.m. that afternoon.After consideration of the various alternative courses, the War Cabinet:-Authorised the Admiralty to take thebest measures in their power to capture the RICHELIEU, and also the JEAN BARTif she should put to sea. Every step should be taken to avoid bloodshed,and no more force should be used than was necessary. No communication should be made to the French government until the operation had been completed.Richmond Terrace, S.W.1
